body_html:
@zou3519, I think you do not get my doubt. What I want to do is get the diagnol matrix of the given tensor in this form:

a = tensor([[ 1., 2.],
[ 3., 4.],
[ 5., 6.]])

torch.fuction(a) should now return three 2D arrays with following tensors as their diagnol values.

My main focus is to sample values from multivariate Gaussian using mean and variance matrix. This seems to be working when I am using a batch size of 1, however, I am getting errors for a batch size greater than 1. Please let me know how to proceed.
body_text:
@zou3519, I think you do not get my doubt. What I want to do is get the diagnol matrix of the given tensor in this form:
a = tensor([[ 1.,  2.],
[ 3.,  4.],
[ 5.,  6.]])
torch.fuction(a) should now return three 2D arrays with following tensors as their diagnol values.
My main focus is to sample values from multivariate Gaussian using mean and variance matrix. This seems to be working when I am using a batch size of 1, however, I am getting errors for a batch size greater than 1. Please let me know how to proceed.
body:
@zou3519, I think you do not get my doubt. What I want to do is get the diagnol matrix of the given tensor in this form:

a = tensor([[ 1.,  2.],
                  [ 3.,  4.],
                  [ 5.,  6.]])
  
torch.fuction(a) should now return three 2D arrays with following tensors as their diagnol values. 

My main focus is to sample values from multivariate Gaussian using mean and variance matrix. This seems to be working when I am using a batch size of 1, however, I am getting errors for a batch size greater than 1. Please let me know how to proceed.
